{{Infobox venue | stadium_name = Všešportový areál | nickname = | image = [[File:1996-08-06 Kosize-Celtic 0-00003.JPG|275px]] | fullname = Všešportový areál | location = [[Košice]], [[Slovakia]] | coordinates = {{Coord|48|42|7.31|N|21|14|36.03|E|type:landmark_region:SK|display=inline,title}} | broke_ground = | built = | opened = 1976 | renovated = | closed = 1997 (used until 2004 as training ground) | demolished = 2011 | owner = Avalta, s.r.o. | operator = | surface = Grass | construction_cost = | architect = | former_names = | tenants = [[MFK Košice|VSS / ZŤS / 1. FC Košice]] (1976–1997)
[[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]] (1995) | seating_capacity = 30,312 | dimensions = 105×75 m }} '''All sports complex''' (''Všešportový areál'' in [[Slovak language|Slovak]]) was a [[multi-purpose stadium]] in [[Košice]], [[Slovakia]]. ==History==
Všešportový areál stadium was opened by match against [[MŠK Žilina|ZVL Žilina]] on 29 February 1976. The football stadium has been demolished in year 2011. The stadium was primarily used for [[Association football|football]] matches and holds 30,312 spectators. It was also six times home ground for the [[Czechoslovakia national football team]] and four times for [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]]. [[MFK Košice|VSS Košice]], later renamed to ZŤS and 1. FC Košice, there played until 1997. The complex also consisted of several football training grounds, [[basketball]], [[Team handball|handball]] and [[wrestling]] indoor [[arena]]s.{{cite web | url = http://www.cassovia.sk/korzar/archiv/clanok.php3?sub=7.3.2005/53276O | title = Ani chrám futbalu, ba ani drevená dedina | accessdate = 2010-07-27 | date = 2005-03-07 | publisher = ''[[SME (newspaper)|SME]]'' | language = Slovak }}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==New stadium==
The club planned construction of the new stadium for 20,000 spectators in neighbourhood of the old not used Všešportový areál stadium.{{cite web | url = http://www.mfkkosice.sk/c/portal_public/layout?p_l_id=21.111&p_p_id=15&p_p_action=1&p_p_state=maximized&p_p_mode=view&_15_struts_action=%2Fjournal%2Fview_article&_15_article_id=PREZIDENT_PODOLAK&_15_article_version=1.0&_15_cmd=articleCountUpdate | title = Nový štadión vyrastie na blšáku | accessdate = | date = 22 July 2005 | publisher = mfkkosice.sk | language = Slovak}}{{cite web | url = http://www.mfkkosice.sk/c/portal_public/layout?p_l_id=21.111&p_p_id=15&p_p_action=1&p_p_state=maximized&p_p_mode=view&_15_struts_action=%2Fjournal%2Fview_article&_15_article_id=PODOLAK_NOVY_STADION_VIZUAL_NAHLAD&_15_article_version=1.0&_15_cmd=articleCountUpdate | title = Nový štadión už má svoju štúdiu | accessdate = | date = 21 December 2007 | publisher = mfkkosice.sk | language = Slovak}}{{cite web | url = http://www.mfkkosice.sk/c/portal_public/layout?p_l_id=21.111&p_p_id=15&p_p_action=1&p_p_state=maximized&p_p_mode=view&_15_struts_action=%2Fjournal%2Fview_article&_15_article_id=STADION_SCHVALENY&_15_article_version=1.0&_15_cmd=articleCountUpdateY_STADION_VIZUAL_NAHLAD&_15_article_version=1.0&_15_cmd=articleCountUpdate | title = Štadión má zelenú – MFK dostal pozemky do prenájmu na 50 rokov! | accessdate = | date = 21 December 2007 | publisher = mfkkosice.sk | language = Slovak}}{{cite web | url = http://www.profutbal.sk/spravy/?clanok=69767 | title = Nový košický štadión s kapacitou takmer 20 000 | accessdate = | date = 2009-02-26 | publisher = profutbal | language = Slovak | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110719181904/http://www.profutbal.sk/spravy/?clanok=69767 | archivedate = 2011-07-19 | df = }} The estimated cost of the stadium is [[Euro|€]]28 million. However, the construction was not launched and it is not clear when it starts.{{cite web | url = http://www.mfkkosice.sk/c/portal_public/layout?p_l_id=21.111&p_p_id=15&p_p_action=1&p_p_state=maximized&p_p_mode=view&_15_struts_action=%2Fjournal%2Fview_article&_15_article_id=NOVY_STADION_ODKLAD&_15_article_version=1.0&_15_cmd=articleCountUpdate | title = Štadión sa v dohľadnom čase nezačne stavať | accessdate = | date = 2010-07-27 | publisher = MFK Košice official website | language = Slovak}} ==International matches==
Všešportový areál has hosted one friendly and three competitive matches of the [[Slovakia national football team]]. {{footballbox_collapsible |date = 9 March 1995 |time =
Match 9 |round = ''[[Exhibition match|International Friendly]]'' |team1 = {{fb-rt|SVK}} |goals1= [[Peter Dubovský (footballer)|Peter Dubovský]] {{goal|19||69}} |score = 2–1 |report = [http://www.11v11.com/matches/slovakia-v-russia-08-march-1995-245526/] |team2 = {{fb|RUS}} |goals2= [[Valeri Karpin]] {{goal|76}} |stadium=Všešportový areál |location=[[Košice]], [[Slovakia]] |attendance=10,200 |referee=[[Hans-Jürgen Weber]] ([[Germany]]) |result = W |stack=yes }} {{footballbox_collapsible |date = 29 March 1995 |time = 18:00
Match 10 |round = '''[[UEFA Euro 1996 qualifying|1996 UEFA EURO
Qualifying]] [[UEFA Euro 1996 qualifying Group 1|Group 1]]''' |team1 = {{fb-rt|SVK}} |goals1= [[Dušan Tittel]] {{goal|34}}
[[Jaroslav Timko]] {{goal|40||51}}

[[Dorinel Munteanu]] {{goal|82}} |stadium= Všešportový areál |location= [[Košice]], [[Slovakia]] |attendance = 9,676 |referee = [[Jaap Uilenberg]] ([[Netherlands]]) |result = L |stack=yes }} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Slovak Super Liga stadiumlist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vsesportovy Areal}} [[Category:Defunct football venues in Slovakia]] [[Category:Multi-purpose stadiums in Slovakia]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Košice Region]] [[Category:Sport in Košice]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 1976]] {{Slovakia-sports-venue-stub}}
